data.text:
@aisyhkhadijah بَارَكَ اللهُ فِيْكُم 🤍

Take care & stay safe, Aisyah!

@NurAtykhStvn بَارَكَ اللهُ فِيْكُم 🤍

Stay safe, Atikah & family! Take care 🤍

May Allah SWT ease everything for us, aamiin aamiin 🤲🏻

#positivecovid19 
#covidfighter

Everyone, please continue to practice social distancing, wearing your mask, washing your hands, and to clean and sanitize your home every hour and every day. Let's all continue our part to stop the spread of Covid-19, Omicron and whatever variant you named it haha.
I know you're starting to feel depressed and starting to have an anxiety issues, you're starting to struggling mentally and emotionally. Please do not hesitate to reach out 🤍

---enjoying netflix and yada-yada.

So, for those who are positive Covid, I know it's hard for you, it's hard for us. I know the one thing that hurts you the most is not being able to physically see your family, your loved ones.

Make way for sore throat~~~on my D-7. It wasn't that bad, just like a normal sore throat. And on the next day, I've got chills and runny nose. But! It ain't that bad either. I can still workout, doing my skincare routine, attending online classes, scrolling social medias---

On my 6 days of self quarantine (close contact with no symptoms), the tests showed positive. And wallahi, I was laughing my ass out loud. It's not because I was happy to get infected but it was unbelievable and quite confused. Who wouldn't?
---ehhhh got covid meh? haaa siao!
